meanings.definition: To preach more effectively or persuasively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outpreach her opponents during debates.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker was able to outpreach the other speakers at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The young preacher tried to outpreach the old pastor, but ended up learning a lot from him instead.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the cause allowed her to outpreach anyone who stood in her way.
meanings.sent5: The way he outpreached his rivals made him a legend in the community.

meanings.sent1: Despite his young age, he managed to outpreach the experienced preachers in town.
meanings.sent2: The charismatic pastor was able to outpreach his competitors and attract a larger congregation.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the two preachers led them to constantly try to outpreach each other.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outpreach others made her a sought-after speaker at events.
meanings.sent5: He outpreached all expectations with his moving sermon.
